column5: After spending $350 on a GPS unit for my boat and another $200 for navionics hot maps chips I just found a $9.99 Navionics Great Lakes app for my iphone.  It has maps for G Bay, Kawarthas, Simco, Great Lakes, Niagra and more!!  Excellent value, a must for any angler with an iphone and maybe an alternative for the angler on a budget.
D'OH!  I wonder if there is a blackberry version?
NICE find!
Holy Crap it must be on sale right now cause it was like 50 bucks
Great find!  Silly question:  What's the difference between marine charts and lake maps?  Thanks.
Purchased it this morning! Can't go wrong for $9.99!!
Hi, Can you give me the exact name so I can find it in my iphone, been waiting for it and I cannot find it today Thanks in advance
Hey Stoty where did you get it?  Rob
You need an Iphone
Got mine as well last week! Price is great.
Go to the App store then under search(bottom of screen) type in Navionics then scroll down to Great Lakes edition.  Enjoy.
Exactly!
Here's a SPECIAL price for only $4.99.........  http://www.navionics.com/Newsletters/Navio...s_US_060109.htm
Hotmaps Canada is $4.99 Navionics Gold Great Lakes is $9.99
I got different name from you guys, some of you said Navonics Great Lakes and some of you said Navonics Gold Great Lakes, which one is right? Thanks!
Gold Great Lakes in the App Store, but it shows up as Navionics Great Lakes on your phone.
Crappie I think your missing the I in navIonics.
Now all they need is the Apple iFish Finder USB attachment for the iPhone and I am all set.
what is Ifish finder USB ?is that another app for finding fish?
As far as I know Apple hasn't invented the iFishfinder USB yet, but give them time. If they can make money from the idea it'll be out by Christmas.
For the Great Lake App. does it show the depth too ?
That's what it's all about
Is this for iPhone only? or does it work with an iTouch?? I don't have either, but would consider an iTouch.   I just dropped $200 on maps for my portable GPS too =\

Wouldnt waste your money on an iTouch just for this app. You'll need an active internet connection in order to use the app. Unless your at home on a wireless connection, its pretty much useless. I guess you can plan out your trips, then bring it along for reference?
